properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 3 at 2:13PM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 213 PM EST...a strong thunderstorm was over Woodville, or near
Greensboro...moving northeast at 55 mph.

HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of this storm include
Washington, Union Point, Tignall, Woodville, Rayle, Jacksons
Crossroads, Mallorysville, Norman, Metasville, Daniel Springs,
Newtown, Celeste, Lyneville, Philomath and Carters Grove.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3356 8308 3371 8318 3399 8283 3399 8282
3398 8280 3373 8256
TIME...MOT...LOC 1913Z 235DEG 49KT 3365 8310

WIND...50MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHWESTERN TALIAFERRO... WILKES...SOUTHEASTERN OGLETHORPE AND NORTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES UNTIL 245 PM EST
